item.title: Using Reticulate
item.description: Reticulate Whenever you need R and Python to work together and share information, you can use reticulate. This is fairly easy! When you insert a chunck (shortcut: Ctrl+Alt+I OR Command+Option+I), you will see {r}. That means that that chunk will be using R. You can change {r} to {python} to simply switch the chunk to a Python code chunk. First, you need to run library(reticulate) in the R code chunk to make R and Python communicate with each other!
